title: Stuffed Cucumber Kimchi
ingredients: - 13 grams (1 tablespoon plus 1½ teaspoons) Diamond Crystal kosher salt
- 1 cup thin half-moon slices white onion
directions: 1. Cut each cucumber almost in half lengthwise, stopping an inch or so from the end. Rotate and make a similar cut to almost quarter them, again stopping an inch from the end.
2. Place cucumbers in a large mixing bowl and rub them, inside and out, with the salt. Let them sit for 10 minutes to draw out liquid.
3. In a medium mixing bowl, combine garlic chives, onion, carrot, gochugaru, shio koji, garlic, ginger, agave syrup, and sesame seeds. Stir well.
4. Drain the cucumbers, give them a quick rinse under cold water, and shake dry.
5. Carefully open the cucumbers and stuff them with some of the chili mixture. Rub additional mixture onto the outsides.
6. Pack the cucumbers and remaining chili mixture into a clean 1-gallon jar or 2-quart rectangular container, finishing with some chili mixture on top.
7. Cover with plastic wrap, pressing it against the surface. Add a small weight, then seal with a lid.
8. Let ferment at room temperature for 4 to 7 days, burping the container after 3 days.
9. After fermentation, store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks. Serve cucumbers whole or cut into 1-inch pieces.
